content: On November 2, 1995, the Atlanta Braves clinched their first World Series title since relocating from Milwaukee by defeating the Cleveland Indians in Game 6 of the Fall Classic. The Braves secured the championship with a 1-0 victory, thanks to a stellar performance by pitcher Tom Glavine, who threw eight scoreless innings. This victory marked the culmination of a dominant era for the Braves and solidified their place in baseball history.
